message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about musical instruments and idiomatic expressions. When one is hitting ebony and ivory and making sound, they are playing a piano. The phrase "hitting ebony and ivory" is a figurative way of referring to playing the keys of a piano, which are often made of ebony and ivory. Option (A) is incorrect because a kitchen utensil does not produce sound when hitting ebony and ivory. Option (B) is incorrect because the phrase "instrument of pain" does not apply in this context. Option (C) is incorrect because hitting ebony and ivory does not refer to a scientific instrument. Option (D) is correct because "playing Chop sticks" is a pun on the term "chopsticks," which is a simple tune that can be played on the piano using only two fingers.
